meta.name: description
meta.content: A Message From Edmentum CEO, Jamie Candee As we continue to see COVID-19 (the coronavirus) impacting our education community, we stand with you, focused on building school around the student - especially during times where access to quality instruction is restricted. We have developed a number of resources that are available to you designed to help as you plan and in the

A Message From Edmentum CEO, Jamie Candee As we continue to see COVID-19 (the coronavirus) impacting our education community, we stand with you, focused on building school around the student - especially during times where access to quality instruction is restricted. We have developed a number of resources that are available to you designed to help as you plan and in the unfortunate event that your school or district closes. Free Resources to Continue Learning During School Closures Don't let community emergencies and other unexpected school closure days derail student learning.

meta.name: dcterms.description
meta.content: A Message From Edmentum CEO, Jamie Candee As we continue to see COVID-19 (the coronavirus) impacting our education community, we stand with you, focused on building school around the student - especially during times where access to quality instruction is restricted. We have developed a number of resources that are available to you designed to help as you plan and in the unfortunate event that your school or district closes. Free Resources to Continue Learning During School Closures Don't let community emergencies and other unexpected school closure days derail student learning.

div.p: K–12 practice and formative assessment
6–12 courses and curriculum
6–12 courses paired with instructional services
K–8 courses paired with instructional services
K–12 assessment-driven, individualized learning paths
7–12 fixed-form assessments
Pre-K–6 foundational literacy and comprehension
Check out the latest enhancements to our programs.
For Home - Catch up, or stay ahead.

a.p: Expert consulting to align technology to your goals
Foster student growth by promoting adoption
Partner with our experts to get the assistance you need

div.p: Sucess Consultant - Always included

a.p: The people who lead the way.

div.p: Jump start your career at Edmentum
Hear from our teachers & experts!

input.title: Enter the terms you wish to search for.
input.name: search_block_form

div.p: Adaptive curriculum, research-based assessments, and educational services

p.strong: A Message From Edmentum CEO, Jamie Candee

div.p: As we continue to see COVID-19 (the coronavirus) impacting our education community, we stand with you, focused on building school around the student - especially during times where access to quality instruction is restricted. We have developed a number of resources that are available to you designed to help as you plan and in the unfortunate event that your school or district closes.

div.h1: Free Resources to Continue Learning During School Closures
div.h4: Don't let community emergencies and other unexpected school closure days derail student learning.

div.p: Do you need access to quality online programming due to school closures?

a.li: Free school- or district-wide access to Study Island, Exact Path, or Courseware paired with implementation support through the end of the school year.
Free access to our standards-based practice program, Study Island for Home, for parents and families

div.a: Get Started Using Study Island or Study Island for Home
Learn More about the E-CAP Program

div.p: Offline options are great to have during unexpected school closures. All of our Edmentum programs include printable items to help you out, but we also rounded up some fun and free options you can download and print right away.

a.li: NEW K-12 Worksheet Bundles: Volume 2
Play the Edmentum Brain Game
K-6 Downloadables for Historical Dates & Holidays

div.h2: Ready to Develop Your Own e-Learning Plan?

div.p: Unprecedented school closures across due to coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) are sending many educators into uncharted territory. In this short guide, we’ve gathered tips and resources for communicating with staff, students, and parents and for building and implementing a plan for e-learning to keep students on track during both long- and short-term school closures.

We've compiled a few of our favorite elementary videos. In top right corner of the video below, you can see a playlist of all available video lessons. We'll continue to add more to this playlist over time.

div.h2: Planning for a Virtual Graduation Ceremony

div.p: We know that graduation ceremonies are critically important to the student experience, but when a virtual format is called for, they can be difficult to achieve. This guide includes tips and best practices for holding commencement ceremonies in a virtual learning world.

p.i: Note: Virtual graduation ceremonies are not a service offered by Edmentum. This guide is intended to help you plan your own event successfully.

div.p: Missed school days can quickly cut into student learning and state instructional hour requirements. Use the resources below to create an effective e-learning plan during unexpected school closures.

a.li: 8 Elements of Effective E-Learning Day Plans
Personalized Learning Plans How-To Guide
5 Things Parents Can Do To Support Virtual Learning
4 Tips for Building an Online Teaching Schedule

p.strong: Study Island 101: Getting Started and Exploring the Basics

div.p: 1:00PM—2:00PM CST

p.strong: Reading Eggs 102: Using Data to Guide Instruction
Virtual Learning in Grades K-5: Best Practices from Calvert Learning to Support Elementary Students

a.li: Keep Students Learning with Contingency Plans
How to Support Your Students During School Closures
How to Support Your Students During School Closures, Part 2
Building District Capacity Through Virtual Instruction
Answering Educator Questions Around Implementing E-Learning
The CARES Act and What Educators Need to Know
How Teachers Can Support Special Education Students in Online Learning
How Educators Can Address Special Populations, Accountability, Staff Training and More When Implementing eLearning
Providing Instruction for Students with Disabilities During School Closures
Answering Educator Questions Around Supporting Students with Disabilities During School Closures
How Educators Can Support Parents and Other Caregivers While Making the Transition to Online Learning
Using SEL Strategies to Navigate in Times of Crisis
Best Practices for Teachers Making the Switch to Virtual Instruction
Navigating Virtual Instruction: Answering Educator Questions
Answering Educator Questions Around Working with Parents through Virtual Learning
How Online Tutoring Can Provide an Extra Layer of Support for Students During School Closures
Crossing the Finish Line: Helping Seniors Graduate During School Closures
Track Proficiency and Progress During a School Closure with Study Island
Staying on Track: Monitoring High School Student Progress Virtually with Edmentum Courseware
Support Academic Growth for All with Exact Path During School Closures

div.h2: Communicate School Closures with Staff and Parents
div.p: We’ve assembled three letter templates that educators can use in the event of school closures. These are available in Microsoft Word, such that you can customize them for your specific needs.

a.li: Letter Template - Communicate with Teachers & Staff
Letter Template - Communicate with Parents, Migration to eLearning
Letter Template - Communicate with Parents, Closing Announcement Only

div.p: We’ve put together specific resources, tools, and tips for each of our online programs to support rigorous e-learning days! If you need access to quality online programming due to school closures, Edmentum would like to provide free program access to our standards-based practice program, Study Island, for families or schools. Click on the link below to learn more.

div.h2: Stay Up-to-Date with the Latest News
div.p: Check out this weeks special edition of the Edmentum News Round up where you can learn the latest news we have gathered pertaining to COVID-19 and the impact on U.S. education.

2425 N Central Expressway
Suite 1000
Richardson, TX 75080

5600 West 83rd Street
Suite 300, 8200 Tower
Bloomington, MN 55437
